item.title: I don't like arrays >.<
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

I’m using this in an RSPS, but it could be used in anything coded in java, so I figured it would be better suited here than in the server help section.

Anyway, I have this variable declared in one of my classes. (Not gonna use the exact one, I’ll just use an example.)
It’s this type of array that I’ve never worked with before.

private int[][][] something = { { {1, 2, 3}, {1, 2} }, { {1, 2, 3, 4}, {1, 2, 3}, {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} } };

I’m trying to find the length of only one of the sets in the array.
Let’s say I wanted the length of this specific one: (The one colored in red)

private int[][][] something = { { {1, 2, 3}, {1, 2} }, { {1, 2, 3, 4}, {1, 2, 3}, {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} } }

How would I do this?
I know the length is 5, but need a method of finding it with a command, like the same way you would find the length of a simple array such as public int[] example = {1, 2, 3};

Read full topic
